intro: Sphenopus gouanii var. permicranthus, commonly known as the Permicranthous sphenopus, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and diverse ecological adaptations. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species with conservation concerns.
